article.headline: LSU 95, New Orleans 79
article.story: BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) -- LSU finished a three-game tour against fellow Louisiana colleges a perfect 3-0, but head coach John Brady wasn't there to see it. Darrel Mitchell scored 20 points to lead the Tigers to a 95-79 win over New Orleans Wednesday night and Brady was ejected for the first time this season. LSU (3-0) scored the first nine points of the game and held a commanding 31-13 lead midway through the first half. Holding the Privateers without a field goal for nearly six minutes, the Tigers' lead ballooned to 48-21 with under three minutes left in the first half. The LSU lead never fell below 13 in the second half. Brady was ejected with 8:53 left in the second half after receiving two technical fouls for arguing a foul call. It was his first ejection of the season and first since a 102-70 loss at Florida in 2002. "Before the game we talked about having our team face an adverse situation," Brady joked. "So we just thought I'd get thrown out the game and see how they could handle that." Antonio Hudson added 18 points for the Tigers. Glenn Davis had 16 points and five rebounds and Brandon Bass had 15 points. Tack Minor had 10 points and 10 assists for his first double-double of the season. "I'm looking forward to a lot more double-doubles," Minor said. "I'm trying to be a lot more unselfish and try to be a true point guard. I showed that today that I can get my teammates involved and not just score points." Bo McCalebb led the Privateers (1-3) with a game-high 35 points. Bo Elias had 14 points and Shawn Malloy and Chad Barnes added 11 each. Privateers head coach Monte Towe said his team still has to make significant improvements defensively. "When you go on the road and you play an excellent team like LSU you cannot start the game giving them nine straight points like we did tonight," he said. "The score is what it is. Even though it was a 40-minute game, still the first five minutes of each half are very important. They kind of set the tempo."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
